content.question: A curve in the <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is given by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graph of <math alttext="x of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above on the left, and the graph of the derivative <math alttext="y prime of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above on the right. Which of the following integral expressions gives the length of the portion of the curve described by the parametric equations for <math alttext="1 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from 1 to 3, of, the square root of t minus 1, end root, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 1 to 3, of, the square root of t squared, plus 2 t, plus 5, end root, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="one half times, the integral from 1 to 3, of, the square root of t squared, plus 2 t, plus 5, end root, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="one half times, the integral from 1 to 3, of, the square root of t to the fourth power, plus 4 times t cubed, plus 20 times t squared, minus 96 t, plus 144, end root, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>20</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>96</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>144</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from 1 to 3, of, the square root of t squared, plus 2 t, plus 5, end root, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.3: (BC ONLY) Finding Arc Lengths of Curves Given by Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
